abstract: As he presides over the courtroom battle between the British financier Guy Hands and Citigroup, Judge Jed S. Rakoff entertains with a wry sense of humor, blunt talk and a passion for the legal process.
snippet: As he presides over the courtroom battle between the British financier Guy Hands and Citigroup, Judge Jed S. Rakoff entertains with a wry sense of humor, blunt talk and a passion for the legal process.
lead_paragraph: Loyal DealBook readers know that Judge Jed S. Rakoff runs a lively courtroom. Judge Rakoff has recently overseen several prominent cases, including the Securities and Exchange Commission‘s lawsuit against Bank of America over executive bonuses.

headline.main: At Citigroup Trial, the Wit and Wisdom of Judge Rakoff

abstract: Two years after the Fed bought billions of dollars in mortgage securities as part of the financial bailout, it is pressing banks to buy some of them back.
snippet: Two years after the Fed bought billions of dollars in mortgage securities as part of the financial bailout, it is pressing banks to buy some of them back.
lead_paragraph: To the long list of those picking fights with banks over bad mortgages, add the Federal Reserve.

headline.main: Fed Wants Banks to Buy Back Some Bad Mortgages

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Federal Reserve Bank of New York

abstract: Bank of America may have announced that it will resume foreclosures, but state law-enforcement officials and the White House say they will continue their inquiries.
snippet: Bank of America may have announced that it will resume foreclosures, but state law-enforcement officials and the White House say they will continue their inquiries.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America may be trying to bring down the curtain on the foreclosure furor, but there are numerous indications that the problems will not move off-stage so quickly, David Streitfeld reports in The New York Times.

headline.main: Intermission, at Best, in Battle Over Foreclosures

abstract: Goldman Sachs will share $3.8 billion between the 35,400 people in its employ in the third quarter, a pay pool down significantly from the same time last year, The Financial Times reports.
snippet: Goldman Sachs will share $3.8 billion between the 35,400 people in its employ in the third quarter, a pay pool down significantly from the same time last year, The Financial Times reports.
lead_paragraph: Goldman Sachs will divide $3.8 billion among 35,400 employees in the third quarter, a pay pool reduced significantly from the period a year earlier, The Financial Times reported.

headline.main: Under Spotlight, Goldman to Cut Compensation
